report_title: Industry Research: Air Gun & Airsoft Gun Manufacturing
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2020 currency. Operators in the Air Gun and Airsoft Gun Manufacturing industry have experienced volatile conditions over the five years to 2020. Industry operators develop and produce guns that shoot projectiles, including BBs and pellets, using compressed air to propel the ammo instead of an explosive. Industry products are used for various recreational, hunting and sporting activities, including target shooting. After benefiting from years of pent-up demand, the industry began to normalize early during the period as demand leveled. Combined with falling exports and lower participation in hunting, industry revenue began to falter. Rising discretionary income was not enough to encourage sales of industry products. Thus, industry revenue has decreased an annualized 2.7% to $291.1 million over the five years to 2020, including a decline of 0.3% in 2020 alone as consumers encountered an adverse social and economic climate caused by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue has declined an annualized 2.7% to $291.1 million over the five years to 2020, including a decline of 0.3% in 2020 alone due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
The volatility is due to multiple demand dynamics like pent-up demand being satisfied early in the period, declining hunting participation, and the industry's link to the traditional gun industry.
Exports declined at an annualized 13.2% to $28.2 million due to dollar appreciation making exports expensive. Imports fell 4.7% to $153.5 million due to weakening domestic demand.
Demand has started climbing recently due to civil unrest and calls to defund law enforcement, as air guns represent viable self-defense products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry revenue is forecast to grow an annualized 1.0% to $305.9 million over the five years to 2025 as economic conditions improve and interest in target shooting remains.
A depreciating dollar will likely boost exports, forecast to grow 1.4% annually to $30.3 million. Imports will also rise 0.2% to $155.3 million due to higher domestic demand.
Industry performance may be tempered by regulation related to traditional gun regulation affecting the industry.
The number of enterprises is expected to remain flat at 19, while employment will rise 0.8% to 1,016 workers due to higher production.

industry_definition: This industry primarily manufactures air guns and airsoft guns, which are distinct from firearms. Air guns and airsoft guns use air or gas, while firearms burn a propellant. Air guns and airsoft guns are used for hunting, pest control, target shooting and other recreational activities.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - steady

key_trends: The far laxer regulations surrounding industry products often makes them more accessible to consumers
An appreciating US dollar has negatively affected exports' share of revenue over the past five years
Industry profit has risen due to subdued labor and input costs amid a rejuvenation in demand in 2020
As the economy recovers, per capita disposable income is anticipated to rise to the benefit of the industry
Aside from increased import competition, industry performance is likely to be tempered by regulation
Industry profit is anticipated to remain stagnant due to increases in input prices and competition
Recent civil unrest in major US cities has contributed to an uptick in industry demand

market_segmentation.segment_description: Mass merchants will account for 45.7% of industry revenue in 2020.
Other retail, such as direct sales to consumers, especially through online channels, accounts for 35.6% of industry revenue in 2020.
Exports are expected to account for 9.7% of industry revenue in 2020.
Dealers or marketing companies with dealer services are estimated to account for 9.0% of industry revenue in 2020.

products_and_services.product_description: Air guns are expected to represent the industry's largest product line, accounting for 63.6% of revenue in 2020.
Airsoft guns are expected to account for 20.5% of industry revenue in 2020.
Other products and services are expected to account for 15.9% of revenue in 2020.

tier_1_suppliers: Wire & Spring Manufacturing in the US
Machine Shop Services in the US
tier_1_buyers: Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
Guns & Ammunition Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
Warehouse Clubs & Supercenters in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Given the degree of globalization within the Air Gun and Airsoft Gun Manufacturing industry, trends in the trade-weighted index (TWI) are particularly important for industry performance.
Given that air guns and airsoft guns are primarily used recreationally for target shooting, hunting and sports, trends in leisure time form another essential component of industry demand.
Per capita income and consumer sentiment levels, which are linked to vagaries in the economic cycle, also affect demand for air gun and airsoft gun manufacturing.
Air guns and airsoft guns can offer a less expensive and safe option to get kids interested in target shooting using traditional guns.
Hunting is another demand determinant for the industry because industry products are used to hunt small game, such as birds and rabbits.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The value of imported air gun and airsoft guns has declined, falling at an annualized rate of 4.7% to $153.5 million over the five years to 2020.

A moderate and declining share of the industry's revenue is derived from international markets. The value of industry exports has dropped at an annualized rate of 13.2% to $28.2 million over the five years to 2020.

business_locations.location_description: Most industry operators are located in the Southeast region, accounting for 21.0% of establishments in 2020. Florida is a popular location since it is able to effectively serve a diverse range of customers in both the domestic and international markets.
The Southwest region is another prominent center for industry operators, accounting for 16.1% of industry establishments in 2020. Texas is a prominent state in this region.
The Great Lakes region is another significant region for the industry, accounting for 17.0% of establishments in 2020. The Great Lakes is a manufacturing hub in the United States.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Companies are subject to various federal, state and local environmental laws and regulations like the Clean Water Act, Solid Waste Disposal Act, Clean Air Act and noise pollution standards.
Federal law requires airsoft guns to have orange barrel tips to differentiate from firearms. Air guns are not classified as firearms under federal laws.
Several states have laws regulating the sale, usage and taxation of air guns and airsoft guns, like age restrictions and requirements for licensed air refill centers.

barriers_points.barrier_description: One of the primary barriers is the capital investment necessary to establish a facility, purchase machinery, employ labor, develop marketing and roll out products.
Research and development investments are substantial as operators undertake product innovation efforts to effectively compete.
Many incumbents have developed strong relationships with suppliers and markets, making it difficult for new entrants to break in.
For certain segments, competing against established brands requires funds for advertising to establish consumer interest.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators compete mainly on price, quality and product innovation. Domestic manufacturers face pressure to limit costs due to import competition.
High external competition from imports satisfying 36.9% of domestic demand in 2020. Competition from substitute entertainment forms like video/mobile games.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Medium and steady globalization. Imports over 35% of demand, exports 9.7% of revenue. Foreign manufacturers have distribution arrangements.
Velocity Outdoor Inc. has 35.5% market share. Other large players like Daisy manufacture overseas so not included in industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases mainly consist of raw materials, such as steel, plastic, wood, springs, screws and other parts used during the manufacturing and assembly processes.
Wage costs are estimated to account for 20.0% of revenue in 2020, making them the third-largest expense for industry operators.
Depreciation costs fluctuate between operators depending on their size and the capital expenses involved. The cost of new plants and equipment used to manufacture industry products is significant.
Other costs include communications, legal, accounting, repairs and maintenance expenses and account for 26.6% of revenue in 2020.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Capital investment relative to labor costs
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2020, IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on wages, the average industry operator will likely spend $0.13 on capital investments.

Most operators within the industry are large manufacturing plants which derive a substantial share of revenue from other operations, so they spend comparatively less on capital investments than labor.
Manufacturers require a sizeable ongoing investment to maintain property, plant and equipment and to prevent potential downtime.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Since the industry manufactures a mostly discretionary product used primarily for recreational use, demand is susceptible to fluctuations in prevailing consumer sentiment and economic conditions.
Industry operators are subject to volatility associated with changes in the price of purchased inputs like plastic, steel and other raw materials.
High reliance on trade and competition from lower-cost imports has heightened revenue volatility for the industry.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The most effective technological force has been rising technological innovation surrounding 3D printing and other alternative manufacturing methodologies.
Technological changes have focused on introducing air guns and airsoft guns with greater accuracy and range, like precharged pneumatic (PCP) and electronic PCP (ePCP) air guns.
Manufacturers have produced airsoft products that better simulate firearms, like hybrid airsoft guns with battery-powered motors and blowback systems.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports from low-wage countries like China have reduced pricing power, offering US manufacturers less flexibility and autonomy when setting prices.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Having a diversified product line helps operators cater to multiple markets and spread out risk.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing heavily in R&D to meet changing consumer preferences?
FAQs.answer: R&D investment has been crucial for manufacturers to stay at the forefront of development in air gun range and accuracy.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of steel and plastic can be volatile and can threaten profit margins if they rise.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: By mitigating labor expenses, advance technologies enable manufacturers to improve operational efficiencies by applying the most skilled workers in areas of high value.

FAQs.question: How does your company invest in technology, such as 3D printing, to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Incorporating technology from outside the industry, such as 3D printing, can reduce manufacturing expenses.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all relevant health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies must meet a range of federal safety requirements for their products.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Expenses related to meeting energy-efficiency, safety and environmental standards are ongoing.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Cash flow in this industry is somewhat seasonal, with sales strongest during the holiday season.

FAQs.question: How has price volatility of inputs affected profit margins over the past 12 months?
FAQs.answer: Plastic prices are highly volatile because of their reliance on oil, which is itself a volatile commodity.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain product quality? Do you have systems in place to keep standards high and continually?
FAQs.answer: In providing high-quality products and services, companies must maintain detailed and extensive quality assurance programs.

FAQs.question: Do you have a reputation for good quality service? Do you manufacture any branded products?
FAQs.answer: Strong brand recognition is considered to be a major basis of competition.

FAQs.question: Does your company have close relationships with several producers? How can you cultivate these relationships?
FAQs.answer: The cultivation, maintenance and control of downstream distribution channels are a distinct advantage in the industry.

FAQs.question: How resilient or sensitive are your products to consumers' leisure time habits? How will your company mitigate this threat?
FAQs.answer: Time spent on leisure and sports includes recreational activities like target shooting, hunting and other time spent with air and airsoft guns.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your sales are to adults aged 20 to 64? Are there any other markets that are significant to your business?
FAQs.answer: Adults between the ages of 20 and 64 represent a key demographic for this industry since the lower bound represents the age at which an individual is legally entitled to purchase an industry product.

FAQs.question: How do you stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low? How will you take advantage of this?
FAQs.answer: For most consumers, air guns and airsoft guns are discretionary purchases.
